ajmc.ocr.tesseract package#

Submodules#

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.dictionaries module#

Utils to handle tesseract dictionaries, BR and MR’s dictionaries and combine them with tesseract’s dictionaries to create new models.

Architecture should be: XP_DIR / models / model_name / model_name.traineddata

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.dictionaries.change_traineddata_wordlist(traineddata_name: str, wordlist_name: str)[source]#

Change the wordlist of a traineddata file

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.dictionaries.get_mr_abbr_wordlist(langs: List[str]) → List[str][source]#

Get the wordlist of the MR abbreviation dictionary

Gets the path to wordlist.txt file, creating it if it doesn’t exist

Get the wordlist of a traineddata file

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.experiments module#

Contains the code for running experiments.

Creates the experiment repo

Creates an empty experiment directory with its subdirectories

Makes the experiments

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.models module#

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.models.get_training_command(model_config: dict) → str[source]#

Gets the tess training command given a model model_config

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.models.make_model(model_config: dict, overwrite_models: bool = False, overwrite_datasets: bool = False) → None[source]#

Creates the model repo

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.models.make_model_dirs(model_id: str)[source]#

Creates an empty model directory with its subdirectories

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.models.make_models(models_ids: List[str] | None = None, overwrite_models: bool = False, overwrite_datasets: bool = False)[source]#

Creates datasets.

Parameters:

  • models_ids – The list of models to create. If None, creates all models.

  • overwrite_models – Wheter to overwrite existing models.

  • overwrite_datasets – Wheter to overwrite existing datasets.

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.models.run(img_dir: Path, output_dir: Path, langs: str, config: dict = None, psm: int = 3, img_suffix: str = 'png', tessdata_prefix: Path = PosixPath('/Users/sven/packages/tesseract_/tessdata'))[source]#

Runs tesseract on images in img_dir.

Note

assumes tesseract is installed.

Parameters:

  • img_dir (Path) – path to directory containing images to be OCR’d

  • output_dir (Path) – path to directory where OCR’d text will be saved

  • langs (str) – language(s) to use for OCR. Use ‘+’ to separate multiple languages, e.g. ‘eng+fra’

  • config (dict) – dictionary of config options to pass to tesseract. See https://tesseract-ocr.github.io/tessdoc/Command-Line-Usage.html

  • psm (int) – page segmentation mode. See https://tesseract-ocr.github.io/tessdoc/Command-Line-Usage.html

  • img_suffix (str) – suffix of images to be OCR’d

  • tessdata_prefix (Path) – path to directory containing tesseract language data

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.models.train(model_config: dict)[source]#

ajmc.ocr.tesseract.pipeline module#

Train or evaluate tesseract

Usage:

$ /scratch/sven/anaconda3/envs/ajmc/bin/python ajmc/ocr/tesseract/pipeline.py --make_experiments
